entries.meaning: (law, rare) A sentence or condemnation in advance.
examples: To move on that note from our deficient techniques of fact-gathering, there is a troublesome quality of class bias both in the subjects treated in foresentence reports and the standard modes of treatment.

verbs.description: foresentence (third-person singular simple present foresentences, present participle foresentencing, simple past and past participle foresentenced)

entries.meaning: (transitive, rare) To sentence beforehand or in advance.
examples: On the strength of having a good time in one's teens, one foresentences one's manhood to derision at an early age: and to a life-long subjection to women and younger exoletes.
